Das Bundesamt für Sport BASPO fördert auf Bundesebene den Sport und die Bewegung in der Schweiz und deren positive, nützliche und notwendige Rolle in der Gesellschaft. J+S ist das grösste Sportförderungsprogramm des Bundes. J+S-Kurse und Lager sind offen für alle Kinder und Jugendliche im Alter zwischen 5 und 20 Jahren an. In der Kaderbildung werden J+S-Leiterinnen und -Leiter, J+S-Expertinnen und -Experten sowie J+S-Coaches aus- und weitergebildet. Rund CHF 100 Mio. werden von J+S als Subventionen an Vereine, Nationale Sport- und Jugendverbände, Schulen, Kantone und weitere Partner ausbezahlt. In der Umsetzung, Weiterentwicklung und Kontrolle des Programms J+S wird das BASPO von den Kantonen und Verbänden unterstützt. 
Zur Verwaltung und Abwicklung sämtlicher J+S-Kurse und J+S-Lager sowie der J+S-Subventionen wird die «Nationale Datenbank für Sport» (NDS) verwendet. In dieser Applikation werden jährlich über 940'000 Teilnahmen von Kindern und Jugendlichen an J+S-Kursen und -Lagern verwaltet. Die NDS verzeichnet heute gegen 100'000 Zugriffe pro Monat.
Mit der NDS-App können Sie als J+S-Leiterin oder -Leiter einen reduzierten Funktionsumfang der Webapplikation auf Ihrem Smartphone nutzen. Die wichtigsten Funktionalitäten der NDS-App sind: 
-	Übersicht der offenen Anwesenheitskontrollen
-	Anwesenheitskontrolle der J+S-Kurse und -Lager führen
-	J+S-Aktivitäten (z. B. Training) erfassen, bearbeiten und löschen
-	J+S-Kurse und -Lager einsehen und bearbeiten
-	Personen den J+S-Kursen und -Lagern hinzufügen oder entfernen
-	App-Einstellungen verwalten (z. B. Sprache, Dark Mode, biometrisches Login)

Die NDS-App wird regelmässig weiterentwickelt und verbessert.

White Risk is the SLF avalanche app for all those who engage in winter activities in the mountains outside marked and open pistes. It gives access to the interactive avalanche bulletin as well as the latest snow and weather data for Switzerland. White Risk also provides background knowledge to assist in assessing the avalanche danger, and tools to facilitate planning both before departure and en route, for ski touring, snowshoe hiking and freeriding expeditions.

The app’s Tour function allows tours planned on the web platform to be viewed offline on topographical maps with slope angles. Tours can also be planned or edited directly in the app.

Control your heating products conveniently from your smartphone using the free app. Whether it be heat vests, socks, gloves, vests or soles - with the Lenz heat app, the heat setting of the lithium packs can be regulated quickly and without complications. Additionally, it provides an overview of the current charge level of all the lithium packs. This is perfect if the heating product is under several layers of clothes.

Advantages of the app:

EACH LITHIUM PACK CAN BE CONTROLLED SEPARATELY
Each of the connectible lithium packs can be set to a different heat level so you get just as much heat as you need everywhere. 

INTERVAL FUNCTION
Heating and pause times can be set individually with the interval function, which extends the lithium packs’ lifetime. 

LED-OFF: 
If the LEDs glow through a thin item of clothing, they can be deactivated. The heat output remains set as defined in the app.

ORDER FOR THE LITHIUM PACKS
Coloured rubber rings are delivered with the lithium packs. These help you to distinguish entire “battery pairs” from each other or to distinguish the batteries that are purposely to be used on the left and on the right. You can assign the colour of the rubber rings to the batteries in the app. 

LED SYSTEM:
The Lenz LED system 1.0 can also be controlled with the app. Different colours, lighting modes and brightness levels can be set.

Smartphone requirements for running the Lenz heat app:
- iOS 8.0 or above
- Bluetooth 4.0 (SMART ready)

Topscorers - This is THE Swiss Hockey Manager App of the National League! Compete against friends in your own league and collect live points with your favorite players on game days. In addition to the official game schedule, table and game center, the app offers more than 40 live statistics for all games of the championship. Download now and win the championship with your dream team!

**General**
In the Topscorers app, users compete against each other in a league by putting together the most competitive ice hockey team possible from current National League professionals with a set budget. In each league, each hockey player exists only once. Before a game day, each user puts together his team from the players available to him. The sum of the points collected in real time for each player results in the total number of points for his team per game day. The users play to win the regular season (qualifier) and the playoffs (champion).

**Live points**
The game principle of Topscorers is based on real events in the National League. On each National League game day you get points for the game actions of your lined up hockey players. These refer to the statistically recorded (live) performance data of the National League.

**Create a league**
Create your own league and invite your friends against whom you want to play the season. In one league 1-14 users can play.

**Game mode**
At the beginning of your Topscorers season you will be assigned a 20-player team worth CHF 3 million. The line-up is automatically generated from these 20 players and can be customized. In addition, you will receive a budget of CHF 1 million to make transfers. On the transfer market you can buy new players or sell players from your squad. But be careful, you must not have a negative account balance before the start of the game, otherwise you will not get any points for the whole game day.

Whympr is the mountain community app that accompanies mountain and outdoor sports enthusiasts (hiking, climbing, trail running, mountain biking, ski touring, snowshoeing, mountaineering…) BEFORE, DURING and AFTER their outings.

BEFORE YOUR OUTING 

- Discover more than 300,000 routes all over the world, in the mountains or anywhere else, from sources such as Skitour, Camptocamp and Tourist Offices
- Filter by activity, level of difficulty, point of interest, to find the outing that suits you the best
- Get inspiration and check recent conditions: more than 150,000 users are on Whympr sharing their outings 
- Access topographic maps, including IGN, SwissTopo and slope inclination
- Download your itinerary to view it offline
- Buy Pro Topos: routes created and illustrated by professionals and mountain guides, with activities including climbing, ski touring, mountaineering and hiking 
- Access detailed weather forecasts and check avalanche bulletins for your location or the area you're targeting
- Find out how to get to the start of the route (check if there is parking or if you can get there by public transport for a more eco-friendly outing)
- Avoid protected areas to preserve sensitive plants and wildlife by activating the "sensitive area" visual layer

DURING YOUR OUTING

- Geolocate yourself on the map of your choice
- Record your GPS tracks and view your outing statistics (distance, time, elevation, etc.)
- Add your photos:  these will be geolocated on the map and overlaid on your outing track
- Describe your outing (conditions, challenges encountered, gorgeous hidden places you found…)
- Share your outing with the Whympr community and on your social media

AFTER YOUR OUTING

- View your outing and retain a memory from your adventure
- Access your profile to view all of your recent activities on a map
- View the dashboard of your complete outing statistics
- Become a valuable member of a community of amazing mountain and outdoor enthusiasts

Whympr uses a freemium model. You can download the basic app on your iPhone for free and test the premium version for free for 7 days.

- Many base maps including IGN France and SwissTopo
- Offline mode
- Advanced route filter
- Detailed weather conditions
- GPS track recording
- GPX import
- Save your favorite areas to quickly access local weather forecast and avalanche report
